result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
VIP Program for a period of 6 Months
Conditions:
Attend ACS Groups or day report at a level determined by the case manager
Obtain an AODA and comply with recommendations for treatment
Do not possess/consume non prescribed controlled substances  
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming non prescribed controlled substances
Maintain absolute sobriety
Particpate in any other community based services as determined by case manager
Obtain and maintain full time schooling or employment or a combination of both to equal full time
If Defendant successfully completes the program, case will be dismissed
If Defendant does not successfully complete, Court will then order a sentencing

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin T. Darinski Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from JusticeWorks
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
VIP

Defendant Justin T. Darinski Rivera in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:40 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

This is scheduled for a plea.

There is a plea agreement.
State has filed an amended information, amending Count 1.

Defendant will plead to amended Count 1.
Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.

State recommends the Court to withhold entry of judgment and place Defendant on the VIP Program.
Atty Drengler concurs.

Court takes a moment to review the assessment.

Atty Drengler has received a copy of the amended information, waives reading at this time.


 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to WITHOLD entry Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: 961.41(3g)(d)
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
VIP Program for a period of 6 Months
Conditions:
Attend ACS Groups or day report at a level determined by the case manager
Obtain an AODA and comply with recommendations for treatment
Do not possess/consume non prescribed controlled substances  
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming non prescribed controlled substances
Maintain absolute sobriety
Particpate in any other community based services as determined by case manager
Obtain and maintain full time schooling or employment or a combination of both to equal full time
If Defendant successfully completes the program, case will be dismissed
If Defendant does not successfully complete, Court will then order a sentencing
Defendant Record Update
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on January 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Record Update
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on October 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Atty Drury to be substituted with another PD attorney.
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

State files information.
Atty Drury received a copy of the information and waives reading.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Bond is ordered continued.

Atty Drury files paperwork for change of counsel in this matter.

Defendant Justin T. Darinski Rivera in court with attorney Sean Drury. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:56 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Both parties are prepared to proceed.

3:57 PM Brian Noll is called and sworn in, detective with Plover Police Department.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
Witness identifies Defendant.
4:04 PM Cross-examination by Atty Drury.
4:12 PM Re-direct by Atty Knaapen.

Atty Drury addresses the Court, gives argument.
Court reviews the facts of the case, on the record.

Court determines there is sufficient probable cause  that a felony was committed and that Defendant committed the felony and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin T. Darinski Rivera in court with attorney Sean Drury. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin T. Darinski Rivera in court with attorney Sean Drury. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT: Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming unlawful controlled substances.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On all days that are scheduled for Court.
No contact with Alicia Babler.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin T. Darinski Rivera
Current: 1530 Post Road, Plover, WI 54467   (Effective: 06-24-2014)
Prior: 2701 Forest Drive #107, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant Justin T. Darinski Rivera appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Knaapen makes statements re: warrant. 
Court questions defendant.  
Defendant lives with his mother, he is working at the Plover Taco Bell as a night manager.  He is not on probation.  He has not seen the Public Defender or hired an attorney on his own. 
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation. 

Court informs defendant of charges/maximum penalties. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint. 
Defendant would like to have an attorney.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will continue for 2 weeks to allow for appointment of counsel. 

Atty Knaapen recommends a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
